supportedFeatures.description: Temporarily unexpire flags that expired as of M82. These flags will be removed soon.
supportedFeatures.name: Temporarily unexpire M82 flags.

supportedFeatures.description: Temporarily unexpire flags that expired as of M83. These flags will be removed soon.
supportedFeatures.name: Temporarily unexpire M83 flags.

supportedFeatures.description: Overrides the built-in software rendering list and enables GPU-acceleration on unsupported system configurations.
supportedFeatures.name: Override software rendering list

supportedFeatures.description: Enables the use of the GPU to perform 2d canvas rendering instead of using software rendering.
supportedFeatures.name: Accelerated 2D canvas

supportedFeatures.description: Select strategies used to promote quads to HW overlays.
supportedFeatures.name: Select HW overlay strategies

supportedFeatures.description: Tint contents composited using GL with a shade of red to help debug and study overlay support.
supportedFeatures.name: Tint GL-composited content

supportedFeatures.description: Visualize overdraw by color-coding elements based on if they have other elements drawn underneath.
supportedFeatures.name: Show overdraw feedback

supportedFeatures.description: Sets partial swap behavior.
supportedFeatures.name: Partial swap

supportedFeatures.description: Support in WebRTC for processing capture audio in multi channel without downmixing when running APM in the render process.
supportedFeatures.name: WebRTC multi-channel capture audio processing.

supportedFeatures.description: Allows viewing of simplified web pages by selecting 'Customize and control Chrome'>'Distill page'
supportedFeatures.name: Enable Reader Mode

supportedFeatures.description: Allow collecting WebRTC event logs and uploading them to Crash. Please note that, even if enabled, this will still require a policy to be set, for it to have an effect.
supportedFeatures.name: WebRTC remote-bound event logging

supportedFeatures.description: When enabled, WebRTC will try to negotiate GCM cipher suites for SRTP.
supportedFeatures.name: Negotiation with GCM cipher suites for SRTP in WebRTC

supportedFeatures.description: Enable new estimator for the encoder cpu load, for evaluation and testing. Intended to improve accuracy when screen casting.
supportedFeatures.name: WebRTC new encode cpu load estimator

supportedFeatures.description: Conceal local IP addresses with mDNS hostnames.
supportedFeatures.name: Anonymize local IPs exposed by WebRTC.

supportedFeatures.description: When enabled, WebRTC will only use the Video Encode Accelerator for video resolutions inside those published as supported.
supportedFeatures.name: WebRTC Min/Max Video Encode Accelerator dimensions

supportedFeatures.description: Enable a separate toolbar button and menu for extensions
supportedFeatures.name: Extensions Toolbar Menu

supportedFeatures.description: Enables running extensions on chrome:// URLs, where extensions explicitly request this permission.
supportedFeatures.name: Extensions on chrome:// URLs

supportedFeatures.description: Annotates web forms with Autofill field type predictions as placeholder text.
supportedFeatures.name: Show Autofill predictions

supportedFeatures.description: Animate smoothly when scrolling page content.
supportedFeatures.name: Smooth Scrolling

supportedFeatures.description: Enable the SMS Receiver API to work across devices
supportedFeatures.name: SMS Receiver Cross Device

supportedFeatures.description: Enable experimental QUIC protocol support.
supportedFeatures.name: Experimental QUIC protocol

supportedFeatures.description: Some web pages use legacy or non-standard JavaScript extensions that may conflict with the latest JavaScript features. This flag allows disabling support of those features for compatibility with such pages.
supportedFeatures.name: Latest stable JavaScript features

supportedFeatures.description: Enable web pages to use experimental JavaScript features.
supportedFeatures.name: Experimental JavaScript

supportedFeatures.description: Enable web pages to use experimental WebAssembly features.
supportedFeatures.name: Experimental WebAssembly

supportedFeatures.description: Enables WebAssembly baseline compilation and tier up.
supportedFeatures.name: WebAssembly baseline compiler

supportedFeatures.description: Enables lazy (JIT on first call) compilation of WebAssembly modules.
supportedFeatures.name: WebAssembly lazy compilation

supportedFeatures.description: Enables support for the WebAssembly SIMD proposal.
supportedFeatures.name: WebAssembly SIMD support.

supportedFeatures.description: Enables support for the WebAssembly Threads proposal.
supportedFeatures.name: WebAssembly threads support

supportedFeatures.description: Enables tiered compilation of WebAssembly (will tier up to TurboFan if #enable-webassembly-baseline is enabled).
supportedFeatures.name: WebAssembly tiering

supportedFeatures.description: This enables upcoming and experimental V8 VM features. This flag does not enable experimental JavaScript features.
supportedFeatures.name: Future V8 VM features

supportedFeatures.description: Use GPU to rasterize web content.
supportedFeatures.name: GPU rasterization

supportedFeatures.description: Perform Ganesh raster in the GPU Process instead of the renderer.  Must also enable GPU rasterization
supportedFeatures.name: Out of process rasterization

supportedFeatures.description: Enables experimental Web Platform features that are in development.
supportedFeatures.name: Experimental Web Platform features

supportedFeatures.description: Enables touch UI layout in the browser's top chrome.
supportedFeatures.name: Touch UI Layout

supportedFeatures.description: When enabled makes use of a WebUI-based tab strip.
supportedFeatures.name: WebUI tab strip

supportedFeatures.description: When enabled, displays a set of options to demo and test various features and behaviors of the WebUI tab strip. The WebUI tab strip must also be enabled.
supportedFeatures.name: WebUI tab strip demo options

supportedFeatures.description: Hardware-accelerated video decode where available.
supportedFeatures.name: Hardware-accelerated video decode

supportedFeatures.description: Hardware-accelerated video encode where available.
supportedFeatures.name: Hardware-accelerated video encode

supportedFeatures.description: Enables debugging context menu options such as Inspect Element for packed applications.
supportedFeatures.name: Debugging for packed apps

supportedFeatures.description: Support of username saving and filling on username first flow i.e. login flows where a user has to type username first on one page and then password on another page
supportedFeatures.name: Username first flow

supportedFeatures.description: Annotates web forms with Autofill signatures as HTML attributes. Also marks password fields suitable for password generation.
supportedFeatures.name: Show autofill signatures.

supportedFeatures.description: For developers: use the sandbox service for Google Payments API calls.
supportedFeatures.name: Use Google Payments sandbox servers

supportedFeatures.description: Enables the new permissions backend for Web Bluetooth. This will enable persistent storage of device permissions.
supportedFeatures.name: Use the new permissions backend for Web Bluetooth

supportedFeatures.description: History navigation in response to horizontal overscroll.
supportedFeatures.name: Overscroll history navigation

supportedFeatures.description: This is to be used in conjunction with the enable-navigation-tracing flag. Please select the label that best describes the recorded traces. This will choose the destination the traces are uploaded to. If you are not sure, select other. If left empty, no traces will be uploaded.
supportedFeatures.name: Trace label for navigation tracing

supportedFeatures.description: Match Autofill suggestions based on substrings (token prefixes) rather than just prefixes.
supportedFeatures.name: Substring matching for Autofill suggestions

supportedFeatures.description: Show the checkbox to offer local saving of a credit card downloaded from the server.
supportedFeatures.name: Google Payments card saving checkbox

supportedFeatures.description: Enable the use of WebGL 2.0 Compute API.
supportedFeatures.name: WebGL 2.0 Compute

supportedFeatures.description: Enabling this option allows web applications to access the WebGL Extensions that are still in draft status.
supportedFeatures.name: WebGL Draft Extensions

supportedFeatures.description: Raster threads write directly to GPU memory associated with tiles.
supportedFeatures.name: Zero-copy rasterizer

supportedFeatures.description: Use vulkan as the graphics backend.
supportedFeatures.name: Vulkan

supportedFeatures.description: Enable support for using the native notification toasts and notification center on platforms where these are available.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable native notifications.

supportedFeatures.description: Selects the In-Product Help demo mode.
supportedFeatures.name: In-Product Help Demo Mode

supportedFeatures.description: Threaded handling of scroll-related input events. Disabling this will force all such scroll events to be handled on the main thread. Note that this can dramatically hurt scrolling performance of most websites and is intended for testing purposes only.
supportedFeatures.name: Threaded scrolling

supportedFeatures.description: This flag can be used to turn on verification that the contents of the files on disk for extensions from the webstore match what they're expected to be. This can be used to turn on this feature if it would not otherwise have been turned on, but cannot be used to turn it off (because this setting can be tampered with by malware).
supportedFeatures.name: Extension Content Verification

options.description: Bootstrap (get expected hashes, but do not enforce them)
Enforce (try to get hashes, and enforce them if successful)
Enforce strict (hard fail if we can't get hashes)

supportedFeatures.description: If a page hasn't set an explicit referrer policy, setting this flag will reduce the amount of information in the 'referer' header for cross-origin requests.
supportedFeatures.name: Reduce default 'referer' header granularity.

supportedFeatures.description: Requires dedicated processes for an additional set of origins, specified as a comma-separated list.
supportedFeatures.name: Isolate additional origins

supportedFeatures.description: Disables site isolation (SitePerProcess, IsolateOrigins, etc). Intended for diagnosing bugs that may be due to out-of-process iframes. Opt-out has no effect if site isolation is force-enabled using a command line switch or using an enterprise policy. Caution: this disables important mitigations for the Spectre CPU vulnerability affecting most computers.
supportedFeatures.name: Disable site isolation

supportedFeatures.description: Allows previews to be shown subject to specific preview types being enabled and the client experiencing specific triggering conditions. May be used as a kill-switch to turn off all potential preview types.
supportedFeatures.name: Previews Allowed

supportedFeatures.description: Ignore decisions made by the PreviewsBlockList
supportedFeatures.name: Ignore Previews Blocklist

supportedFeatures.description: Enable a different approach to saving data by configuring the back end server
supportedFeatures.name: Use an alternative Data Saver back end configuration.

supportedFeatures.description: Allow Render Level Data Use Optimization
supportedFeatures.name: Enable Render Level Data Use Optimization

supportedFeatures.description: Enables the feature that preconnects to the user's default search engine.
supportedFeatures.name: Enables preconnections to default search engine

supportedFeatures.description: Enable disabling JavaScript on some pages on slow networks.
supportedFeatures.name: NoScript previews

supportedFeatures.description: Enable using server-provided resource loading hints to provide a preview over slow network connections.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable resource loading hints

supportedFeatures.description: Enable coin flip experimentation of Previews.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable Previews Coin Flip

supportedFeatures.description: Enable probing checks for Isolated Prerenders which will block commit.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable Probing on Navigation Predictor Isolated Prerenders

supportedFeatures.description: Enable Navigation Predictions on the Google SRP to be fully isolated.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable Navigation Predictor Isolated Prerenders

supportedFeatures.description: Allows requests to localhost over HTTPS even when an invalid certificate is presented.
supportedFeatures.name: Allow invalid certificates for resources loaded from localhost.

supportedFeatures.description: Bypasses user engagement checks for displaying app banners, such as requiring that users have visited the site before and that the banner hasn't been shown recently. This allows developers to test that other eligibility requirements for showing app banners, such as having a manifest, are met.
supportedFeatures.name: Bypass user engagement checks

supportedFeatures.description: Enable installed PWAs to update their app manifest data when the site manifest data has changed.
supportedFeatures.name: Desktop PWAs local updating

supportedFeatures.description: Enable installed PWAs to include a menu of shortcuts associated with the app icon in the taskbar on Windows, or the dock on macOS or Linux.
supportedFeatures.name: Desktop PWAs app icon shortcuts menu

supportedFeatures.description: Experimental UI for exploring what PWA windows would look like with a tab strip.
supportedFeatures.name: Desktop PWA tab strips

supportedFeatures.description: Experimental behaviour for "Desktop PWA tab strips" to capture link navigations within the app scope and bring them into the app's tabbed window.
supportedFeatures.name: Desktop PWA tab strip link capturing

supportedFeatures.description: New platform to manage Web Applications metadata. Warning: this feature is incomplete and may corrupt your synced Chrome profile. Test accounts only are advised.
supportedFeatures.name: Desktop PWAs without Extensions

supportedFeatures.description: Connects to the testing server for Chrome Sync.
supportedFeatures.name: Use Chrome Sync sandbox

supportedFeatures.description: Loads the Media Router component extension at startup.
supportedFeatures.name: Load Media Router Component Extension

supportedFeatures.description: Have the Media Router connect to Cast devices on all IP addresses, not just RFC1918/RFC4193 private addresses.
supportedFeatures.name: Connect to Cast devices on all IP addresses

supportedFeatures.description: Enables the native Cast Media Route Provider implementation to be used instead of the implementation in the Media Router component extension.
supportedFeatures.name: Cast Media Route Provider

supportedFeatures.description: Enables experimental features for WebXR.
supportedFeatures.name: WebXR Incubations

supportedFeatures.description: Force the browser to use a particular runtime, even if it would not usually be enabled or would otherwise not be selected based on the attached hardware.
supportedFeatures.name: Force WebXr Runtime

supportedFeatures.description: Enables websites to use the keyboard.lock() API to intercept system keyboard shortcuts and have the events routed directly to the website when in fullscreen mode.
supportedFeatures.name: Experimental system keyboard lock

supportedFeatures.description: Disallows fetches for third-party parser-blocking scripts inserted into the main frame via document.write.
supportedFeatures.name: Block scripts loaded via document.write

supportedFeatures.description: Use Windows Runtime MIDI API for WebMIDI (effective only on Windows 10 or later).
supportedFeatures.name: Use Windows Runtime MIDI API

supportedFeatures.description: Enables a new option to upload credit cards to Google Payments for sync to all Chrome devices.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable offering upload of Autofilled credit cards

supportedFeatures.description: Explicitly force the UI to left-to-right (LTR) or right-to-left (RTL) mode, overriding the default direction of the UI language.
supportedFeatures.name: Force UI direction

supportedFeatures.description: Explicitly force the per-character directionality of UI text to left-to-right (LTR) or right-to-left (RTL) mode, overriding the default direction of the character language.
supportedFeatures.name: Force text direction

supportedFeatures.description: This option enables the TLS 1.3 downgrade hardening mechanism for connections authenticated by local trust anchors. This improves security for connections to TLS-1.3-capable servers while remaining compatible with older servers. Firewalls and proxies that do not function when this is enabled do not implement TLS 1.2 correctly or securely and must be updated.
supportedFeatures.name: TLS 1.3 hardening for local anchors

supportedFeatures.description: This option enables a post-quantum (i.e. resistent to quantum computers) key exchange algorithm in TLS (CECPQ2).
supportedFeatures.name: TLS Post-Quantum Confidentiality

supportedFeatures.description: Import functionality in password settings.
supportedFeatures.name: Password import

supportedFeatures.description: Automatically render all web contents using a dark theme.
supportedFeatures.name: Force Dark Mode for Web Contents

options.description: Enabled with selective inversion of non-image elements
Enabled with selective inversion of everything

supportedFeatures.description: Enable language detection for in-page content which is then exposed to assistive technologies such as screen readers.
supportedFeatures.name: Experimental accessibility language detection

supportedFeatures.description: Enable language detection for dynamic content which is then exposed to assistive technologies such as screen readers.
supportedFeatures.name: Experimental accessibility language detection for dynamic content

supportedFeatures.description: Enables the use of a touch fling curve that is based on the behavior of native apps on Windows.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable experimental fling animation

supportedFeatures.description: Enable experimental Web Payments API features
supportedFeatures.name: Experimental Web Payments API features

supportedFeatures.description: Allow Payment Request API to open a minimal UI to replace the Payment Request UI when appropriate.
supportedFeatures.name: Web Payments Minimal UI

supportedFeatures.description: Filling of passwords when an account is explicitly selected by the user rather than autofilling credentials on page load.
supportedFeatures.name: Fill passwords on account selection

supportedFeatures.description: Enables usage of the Windows.Devices.Sensors WinRT APIs on Windows for sensors
supportedFeatures.name: WinRT Sensor Implementation

supportedFeatures.description: Enables an extra set of sensor classes based on Generic Sensor API, which expose previously unavailable platform features, i.e. AmbientLightSensor and Magnetometer interfaces.
supportedFeatures.name: Generic Sensor Extra Classes

supportedFeatures.description: If enabled, credit card autofill suggestions will not display.
supportedFeatures.name: Credit card autofill ablation experiment.

supportedFeatures.description: Use GDI to print text as simply text
supportedFeatures.name: GDI Text Printing

supportedFeatures.description: Enables the new experimental USB backend for Windows.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable new USB backend

supportedFeatures.description: Google head non personalized search suggestions provided by a compact on device model for incognito
supportedFeatures.name: Omnibox on device head suggestions (incognito only)

supportedFeatures.description: Google head non personalized search suggestions provided by a compact on device model for non-incognito
supportedFeatures.name: Omnibox on device head suggestions (non-incognito only)

supportedFeatures.description: Configures Omnibox on-focus suggestions - suggestions displayed on-focus before the user has typed any input
supportedFeatures.name: Omnibox on-focus suggestions

options.description: Enabled NTP Omnibox - Remote History, Local History
Enabled NTP Omnibox - Remote History + PZPS, Local History
Enabled NTP Omnibox/Realbox - Remote History, Local History
Enabled NTP Omnibox/Realbox - Remote History + PZPS, Local History

supportedFeatures.description: Enables on-focus suggestions on the Open Web, that are contextual to the current URL. Will only work if user is signed-in and syncing, or is otherwise eligible to send the current page URL to the suggest server.
supportedFeatures.name: Omnibox on-focus suggestions for the contextual Web

supportedFeatures.description: Preserves the default match against change when providers return results asynchronously. This prevents the default match from changing after the user finishes typing. Without this feature, if the default match is updated right when the user presses Enter, the user may go to a surprising destination.
supportedFeatures.name: Omnibox Preserve Default Match Against Async Update

supportedFeatures.description: Enables location specific suggestions displayed with images and enhanced layout, similar to #omnibox-rich-entity-suggestions. Enabling this featurewill also enable #omnibox-rich-entity-suggestions.
supportedFeatures.name: Omnibox Local Entity Suggestions

supportedFeatures.description: Enables an experimental scoring mode for suggestions when Google is the default search engine.
supportedFeatures.name: Omnibox Experimental Suggest Scoring

supportedFeatures.description: Midword terms are allowed but not scored.
supportedFeatures.name: Omnibox History Quick Provider Allow but Do Not Score Midword Terms

supportedFeatures.description: Midword matches are allowed and scored when the match begins immediately after the previous match ends.
supportedFeatures.name: Omnibox History Quick Provider Allow Midword Continuations

supportedFeatures.description: Enables various experimental features related to keyword mode, its suggestions and layout.
supportedFeatures.name: Omnibox Experimental Keyword Mode

supportedFeatures.description: Enables not counting submatch suggestions towards total suggestion count.
supportedFeatures.name: Omnibox Loose Max Limit on Dedicated Rows

supportedFeatures.description: Match very short input words to beginning of words in bookmark suggestions.
supportedFeatures.name: Omnibox short bookmark suggestions

supportedFeatures.description: Enable suggestions for switching to open tabs within the Omnibox.
supportedFeatures.name: Omnibox tab switch suggestions

supportedFeatures.description: Put each tab switch suggestion in a separate suggestion, immediately following the original suggestion.
supportedFeatures.name: Omnibox dedicated row tab switch suggestions

supportedFeatures.description: Enable omnibox Pedal suggestions to accelerate actions within Chrome by detecting user intent and offering direct access to the end goal.
supportedFeatures.name: Omnibox Pedal suggestions

supportedFeatures.description: Enable a button row on omnibox suggestions to present actionable items such as keyword search, tab-switch buttons, and Pedals.
supportedFeatures.name: Omnibox suggestion button row

supportedFeatures.description: Surfaces an X button next to deletable omnibox suggestions. This is to make the suggestion removal feature more discoverable.
supportedFeatures.name: Omnibox Suggestion Transparency Options

supportedFeatures.description: Display suggestions for Google Drive documents in the omnibox when Google is the default search engine.
supportedFeatures.name: Omnibox Google Drive Document suggestions

options.description: Enabled server scores capped by rank

supportedFeatures.description: Allows autocompleting bookmark, history, and document suggestions when the user input is a prefix of their titles, as opposed to their URLs.
supportedFeatures.name: Omnibox Autocomplete Titles

supportedFeatures.description: Allow autocompletion for titles and non-prefixes. I.e. suggestions whose titles or URLs contain the user input as a continuous chunk, but not necessarily a prefix, can be the default suggestion. Typically, only suggestions whose URLs are prefixed by the user input can be. The potential variations toggle 4 params: 1) 'Title UI' displays titles, 2) '2-Line UI' includes titles (and URLs when autocompleting titles) on a 2nd line, 3) 'Title AC' autocompletes titles, and 4) 'Non-Prefix AC' autocompletes non-prefixes.
supportedFeatures.name: Omnibox Rich Autocompletion

options.description: Enabled Title UI , 2-Line UI, & Title AC
Enabled Title UI, 2-Line UI, & Non-Prefix AC
Enabled Title UI, Title AC, & Non-Prefix AC
Enabled 2-Line UI, Title AC, & Non-Prefix AC
Enabled Title UI, 2-Line UI, Title AC, & Non-Prefix AC

supportedFeatures.description: Enables browser process logic related to service workers to run on the UI thread rather than the IO thread.
supportedFeatures.name: Service worker on UI thread

supportedFeatures.description: Overrides the effective connection type of the current connection returned by the network quality estimator. Slow 2G on Cellular returns Slow 2G when connected to a cellular network, and the actual estimate effective connection type when not on a cellular network. Previews are usually served on 2G networks.
supportedFeatures.name: Override effective connection type

supportedFeatures.description: Enables forced colors mode for web content.
supportedFeatures.name: Forced Colors

supportedFeatures.description: Starts heap profiling service that records sampled memory allocation profile having each sample attributed with a callstack. The sampling resolution is controlled with --memlog-sampling-rate flag. Recorded heap dumps can be obtained at chrome://tracing [category:memory-infra] and chrome://memory-internals. This setting controls which processes will be profiled since their start. To profile any given process at a later time use chrome://memory-internals page.
supportedFeatures.name: Chrome heap profiler start mode.

supportedFeatures.description: Heap profiling service uses Poisson process to sample allocations. Default value for the interval between samples is 100000 (100KB). This results in low noise for large and/or frequent allocations [size * frequency >> 100KB]. This means that aggregate numbers [e.g. total size of malloc-ed objects] and large and/or frequent allocations can be trusted with high fidelity. Lower intervals produce higher samples resolution, but come at a cost of higher performance overhead.
supportedFeatures.name: Heap profiling sampling interval (in bytes).

supportedFeatures.description: By default heap profiling service records native stacks. A post-processing step is required to symbolize the stacks. 'Native with thread names' adds the thread name as the first frame of each native stack. It's also possible to record a pseudo stack using trace events as identifiers. It's also possible to do a mix of both.
supportedFeatures.name: Heap profiling stack traces type.

supportedFeatures.description: Changes the maximum number of autocomplete matches displayed in the Omnibox UI.
supportedFeatures.name: Omnibox UI Max Autocomplete Matches

supportedFeatures.description: The maximum number of URL matches to show, unless there are no replacements.
supportedFeatures.name: Omnibox Max URL Matches

supportedFeatures.description: Offer suggestions when URL bar (omnibox) is focused.
supportedFeatures.name: Omnibox Zero Suggestions on New Tab Page

supportedFeatures.description: Offer suggestions when the real search box on New Tab Page is focused.
supportedFeatures.name: Zero Suggestions in real search box on New Tab Page

supportedFeatures.description: Offer query refinement suggestions when the URL bar (omnibox) is focused on the default search provider's search results page (SERP).
supportedFeatures.name: Omnibox Zero Suggestions on SERP / On-Focus Query Refinement

supportedFeatures.description: Effectively doubles the max number of Google-provided search suggestions on Android by disabling the 'Instant Extended' check.
supportedFeatures.name: Disable the 'instant extended' limit on search suggestions

supportedFeatures.description: Runs the network service in the browser process.
supportedFeatures.name: Runs network service in-process

supportedFeatures.description: Prevent content scripts of Chrome Extensions from bypassing CORS.
supportedFeatures.name: CORS for content scripts

supportedFeatures.description: Enables Cross Origin Opener Policy.
supportedFeatures.name: Cross Origin Opener Policy

supportedFeatures.description: Enables Cross Origin Opener Policy reporting.
supportedFeatures.name: Cross Origin Opener Policy reporting

supportedFeatures.description: Prefetch requests will not follow redirects, not send a Referer header, not send credentials for cross-origin requests, and do not pass through service workers.
supportedFeatures.name: Prefetch request properties are updated to be privacy-preserving

supportedFeatures.description: Allows users to organize tabs into visually distinct groups, e.g. to separate tabs associated with different tasks.
supportedFeatures.name: Tab Groups

supportedFeatures.description: Allows a tab group to be collapsible and expandable, if tab groups are enabled.
supportedFeatures.name: Tab Groups Collapse

supportedFeatures.description: Enables the feedback app to appear in the tab group editor bubble, if tab groups are enabled.
supportedFeatures.name: Tab Groups Feedback

supportedFeatures.description: Enables loading the OneGoogleBar in an iframe. Otherwise, the OneGoogleBar is loaded inline on chrome://new-tab-page.
supportedFeatures.name: Load OneGoogleBar in an iframe

supportedFeatures.description: Enables a search box in the middle of the NTP that will accept input directly (i.e. not be a "fake" box). Search results will show below the non-fake input ("realbox").
supportedFeatures.name: Real search box in New Tab Page

supportedFeatures.description: Themes the real search box in the middle of the NTP to match the omnibox. Only has an an effect if #ntp-realbox is enabled.
supportedFeatures.name: Make the New Tab page real search box match the omnibox's theme colors

supportedFeatures.description: The WebUI new tab page is a replacement for the local NTP.
supportedFeatures.name: Use the WebUI new tab page when opening a new tab

supportedFeatures.description: Enable parallel downloading to accelerate download speed.
supportedFeatures.name: Parallel downloading

supportedFeatures.description: Enables pointer lock unadjustedMovement. When unadjustedMovement is set to true, pointer movements wil not be affected by the underlying platform modications such as mouse accelaration.
supportedFeatures.name: Enables pointer lock options

supportedFeatures.description: Enables the new download backend that uses offline content provider
supportedFeatures.name: Enable new download backend

supportedFeatures.description: Enables a popup containing tab information to be visible when hovering over a tab. This will replace tooltips for tabs.
supportedFeatures.name: Tab Hover Cards

supportedFeatures.description: Shows a preview image in tab hover cards, if tab hover cards are enabled.
supportedFeatures.name: Tab Hover Card Images

supportedFeatures.description: If enabled, Chrome will trigger system notifications to warn about storage pressure.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable storage pressure UI

supportedFeatures.description: Adds the installed apps warning dialog to the clear browsing data flow which allows users to protect installed apps' data from being deleted.
supportedFeatures.name: Installed Apps in Clear Browsing Data

supportedFeatures.description: Enables network logging to a file named netlog.json in the user data directory. The file can be imported into chrome://net-internals.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable network logging to file

supportedFeatures.description: Change the UI treatment for HTTP pages
supportedFeatures.name: Mark non-secure origins as non-secure

options.description: Enabled (mark with a Not Secure warning and dangerous on form edits)
Enabled (mark with a grey triangle icon)

supportedFeatures.description: Enable the QR-based pairingless BLE protocol for use with the Web Authentication API. (This will also enable the cloud-based protocol on platforms where it is not already enabled.)
supportedFeatures.name: Web Authentication caBLE v2 support

supportedFeatures.description: When enabled, the composition rate will be changed based on the videos' actual fps.
supportedFeatures.name: Use preferred interval for video

supportedFeatures.description: Split partially occluded quads before drawing, discarding the occluded regions, in order to reduce compositing overdraw.
supportedFeatures.name: Split partially occluded quads

supportedFeatures.description: Only display query terms in the omnibox when viewing a search results page.
supportedFeatures.name: Query in Omnibox

supportedFeatures.description: Enable saving PDFs with filled form data.
supportedFeatures.name: Save PDF Forms

supportedFeatures.description: Enable a new option to display two pages side by side in the PDF viewer.
supportedFeatures.name: PDF Two-up View

supportedFeatures.description: When using GDI printing, avoid rasterization if possible.
supportedFeatures.name: Print with reduced rasterization

supportedFeatures.description: When enabled, use XPS printing API instead of the GDI print API.
supportedFeatures.name: Use XPS for printing

supportedFeatures.description: When enabled, use XPS printing API instead of the GDI print API when printing PDF documents.
supportedFeatures.name: Use XPS for printing from PDF

supportedFeatures.description: Defers the loading of images marked with the attribute 'loading=lazy' until the page is scrolled down near them.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable lazy image loading

options.description: Enabled (Automatically lazily load where safe even if not marked 'loading=lazy')

supportedFeatures.description: Defers the loading of iframes marked with the attribute 'loading=lazy' until the page is scrolled down near them.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable lazy frame loading

options.description: Enabled (Automatically lazily load where safe even if not marked 'loading=lazy')

supportedFeatures.description: When enabled, Autofill data related icon will be shown in the status chip next to the profile avatar icon in the toolbar.
supportedFeatures.name: Move Autofill omnibox icons next to the profile avatar icon

supportedFeatures.description: Enable support for experimental developer productivity features, such as import maps and policies for avoiding slow rendering.
supportedFeatures.name: Experimental Productivity Features

supportedFeatures.description: Treat given (insecure) origins as secure origins. Multiple origins can be supplied as a comma-separated list. Origins must have their protocol specified e.g. "http://example.com". For the definition of secure contexts, see https://w3c.github.io/webappsec-secure-contexts/
supportedFeatures.name: Insecure origins treated as secure

supportedFeatures.description: Disallows downloads of unsafe files (files that can potentially execute code), where the final download origin or any origin in the redirect chain is insecure if the originating page is secure.
supportedFeatures.name: Treat risky downloads over insecure connections as active mixed content

supportedFeatures.description: Shows a lookalike interstitial when navigating to target embedding domains(e.g. google.com.example.com).
supportedFeatures.name: Detect target embedding domains as lookalikes.

supportedFeatures.description: Expose annotation- prefixed roles from ARIA Annotations draft specification at https://w3c.github.io/annotation-aria/.
supportedFeatures.name: Expose ARIA Annotation roles

supportedFeatures.description: Enables the live captions feature which generates captions for media playing in Chrome. Turn the feature on in chrome://settings/accessibility.
supportedFeatures.name: Live Captions

supportedFeatures.description: Accepts Origin-Signed HTTP Exchanges to be signed with certificates that do not have CanSignHttpExchangesDraft extension. Warning: Enabling this may pose a security risk.
supportedFeatures.name: Allow Signed HTTP Exchange certificates without extension

supportedFeatures.description: When enabled, the distributors of signed exchanges can let Chrome know alternative signed exchange subresources by setting "alternate" link header. Chrome will prefetch the alternate signed exchange subresources and will load them if the publisher of the main signed exchange has set "allowed-alt-sxg" link header in the signed inner response of the main signed exchange.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable Signed Exchange subresource prefetching

supportedFeatures.description: When enabled, the prefetched signed exchanges is stored to a prefetch cache attached to the frame. The body of the inner response is stored as a blob and the verification process of the signed exchange is skipped for the succeeding navigation.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable Signed Exchange prefetch cache for navigations

supportedFeatures.description: Enable the ephemeral storage for account data for autofill.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable the account data storage for autofill

supportedFeatures.description: When enabled, allows syncing DeviceInfo datatype for users who are signed-in but not necessary sync-ing.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable syncing DeviceInfo in transport-only sync mode.

supportedFeatures.description: Enable navigation suggestions for URLs that are visually similar to popular domains or to domains with a site engagement score.
supportedFeatures.name: Navigation suggestions for lookalike URLs

supportedFeatures.description: Predicts mouse and touch inputs position at rAF time based on previous input
supportedFeatures.name: Enable resampling input events

supportedFeatures.description: Predicts the scroll amount at vsync time based on previous input
supportedFeatures.name: Enable resampling scroll events

supportedFeatures.description: Enable filtering of predicted scroll events
supportedFeatures.name: Filtering scroll prediction

supportedFeatures.description: Enables pointer-based scrollbar scrolling on the compositor thread instead of the main thread
supportedFeatures.name: Compositor threaded scrollbar scrolling

supportedFeatures.description: Calculate window occlusion on Windows will be used in the future to throttle and potentially unload foreground tabs in occluded windows
supportedFeatures.name: Calculate window occlusion on Windows

supportedFeatures.description: Enable showing Happiness Tracking Surveys to users on Desktop
supportedFeatures.name: Happiness Tracking Surveys

supportedFeatures.description: Enable showing Happiness Tracking Surveys Demo to users on Desktop
supportedFeatures.name: Happiness Tracking Surveys Demo

supportedFeatures.description: Enable the latest version of Happiness Tracking Surveys.
supportedFeatures.name: Happiness Tracking Surveys migration

supportedFeatures.description: Enable showing Happiness Tracking Surveys for Settings to users on Desktop
supportedFeatures.name: Happiness Tracking Surveys for Settings

supportedFeatures.description: Enable showing Happiness Tracking Surveys for Privacy Settings to users on Desktop
supportedFeatures.name: Happiness Tracking Surveys for Privacy Settings

supportedFeatures.description: Use Gaia OAuth multilogin for identity consistency.
supportedFeatures.name: Use Multilogin endpoint.

supportedFeatures.description: Enables new profile picker implementation.
supportedFeatures.name: New profile picker

supportedFeatures.description: Choose the graphics backend for ANGLE. D3D11 is used on most Windows computers by default. Using the OpenGL driver as the graphics backend may result in higher performance in some graphics-heavy applications, particularly on NVIDIA GPUs. It can increase battery and memory usage of video playback.
supportedFeatures.name: Choose ANGLE graphics backend

supportedFeatures.description: Enables click to call feature signals to be handled on desktop by showing a list of user's available devices with telephony functionality.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable click to call feature signals to be handled on desktop

supportedFeatures.description: Enables the remote copy feature to handle messages by writing content to the clipboard and showing a notification to the user.
supportedFeatures.name: Enables the remote copy feature to receive messages

supportedFeatures.description: Enables image notifications to be shown for the remote copy feature when receiving a message.
supportedFeatures.name: Enables image notifications for the remote copy feature

supportedFeatures.description: Enables persistent notifications to be shown for the remote copy feature when receiving a message.
supportedFeatures.name: Enables persistent notifications for the remote copy feature

supportedFeatures.description: Enables progress notifications to be shown for the remote copy feature when receiving a message.
supportedFeatures.name: Enables progress notifications for the remote copy feature

supportedFeatures.description: Enables shared clipboard feature signals to be handled by showing a list of user's available devices to share the clipboard.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable shared clipboard feature signals to be handled

supportedFeatures.description: Enables ambient authentication in Incognito mode. This flag may be overriden by policies.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable Ambient Authentication in Incognito mode

supportedFeatures.description: Enables ambient authentication in Guest session. This flag may be overriden by policies.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable Ambient Authentication in Guest session.

supportedFeatures.description: If enabled, shows Sending... animation in omnibox instead of Desktop OS notifications for contextual menu entry points.
supportedFeatures.name: Send tab to self omnibox sending animation

supportedFeatures.description: Enables receiver device to connect and share data using a peer to peer connection.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable receiver device to handle peer connection requests.

supportedFeatures.description: Enables the sender devices to connect with chosen device using a peer to peer connection for transferring data.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable sender device to initiate peer connection requests.

supportedFeatures.description: Prefer sending Sharing message via FCM WebPush authenticated using VAPID.
supportedFeatures.name: Prefer sending Sharing message via VAPID

supportedFeatures.description: Enables right-click UI to share the page's URL via a generated QR Code.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable sharing page via QR Code

supportedFeatures.description: Enables sending Sharing message via commiting to Chrome Sync's SHARING_MESSAGE data type
supportedFeatures.name: Enable sending Sharing message via Sync

supportedFeatures.description: Configures how long after a device was last active that it is eligible for use in sharing features.
supportedFeatures.name: Configures sharing device expiration

supportedFeatures.description: Enables access to the Google Password Manager UI from Chrome.
supportedFeatures.name: Google Password Manager UI

supportedFeatures.description: Enables CSSOM View Scroll Coordinates, this affects to box scroll coordinates in scrollTop / scrollLeft / scrollTo' when ScrollOrigin isn't at the left top corner. i.e. For leftwards overflow direction box the X coordinate will start from 0 to negative value. For upwards box the Y coordinate will start from 0 to negative value. And for other directions(rightwards and downwards) the value will start from 0 to positive
supportedFeatures.name: CSSOM View Scroll Coordinates

supportedFeatures.description: Enable printing the actual GL driver calls.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable gpu service logging

supportedFeatures.description: Enables using media keys to control the active media session. This requires MediaSessionService to be enabled too
supportedFeatures.name: Hardware Media Key Handling

supportedFeatures.description: Enables a delay before commiting the page to screen when navigating between pages in the same origin. This may help avoid a flash of unstyled content for same-origin navigations
supportedFeatures.name: Delay the commit to screen for same-origin navigations

supportedFeatures.description: If enabled, web contents will behave as hidden when it is occluded by other windows.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable occlusion of web contents

supportedFeatures.description: When enabled, the Autofill dropdown's suggestions' labels are displayed using the improved disambiguation format.
supportedFeatures.name: Autofill Uses Improved Label Disambiguation

supportedFeatures.description: Enables the experimental Native File System API, giving websites access to the native file system
supportedFeatures.name: Native File System API

supportedFeatures.description: Increases corner radius on secondary UI.
supportedFeatures.name: MD corners on secondary UI

supportedFeatures.description: Experimental security mode that strengthens the site isolation policy. Controls whether site isolation should use origins instead of scheme and eTLD+1.
supportedFeatures.name: Strict-Origin-Isolation

supportedFeatures.description: When enabled, the server card unmask prompt will not include the checkbox to also save the card locally on the current device upon success.
supportedFeatures.name: Remove the option to save local copies of unmasked server cards

supportedFeatures.description: If enabled, the display compositor will use Skia as the graphics API instead of OpenGL ES.
supportedFeatures.name: Skia API for compositing

supportedFeatures.description: Portals are an experimental web platform feature that allows embedding and seamless transitions between pages. See https://github.com/WICG/portals and https://wicg.github.io/portals/
supportedFeatures.name: Enable Portals.

supportedFeatures.description: Allows portals to load cross-origin URLs in addition to same-origin ones. Has no effect if Portals are not enabled.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable cross-origin Portals.

supportedFeatures.description: When enabled, users will be given the option to use a platform authenticator (if available) to verify card ownership when retrieving credit cards from Google Payments.
supportedFeatures.name: Allow using platform authenticators to retrieve server cards

supportedFeatures.description: Enables the Storage Access API, allowing websites to request storage access when it would otherwise be restricted.
supportedFeatures.name: Storage Access API

supportedFeatures.description: Treat cookies that don't specify a SameSite attribute as if they were SameSite=Lax. Sites must specify SameSite=None in order to enable third-party usage.
supportedFeatures.name: SameSite by default cookies

supportedFeatures.description: Enables UI on chrome://settings/siteData to remove all third-party cookies and site data.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable removing SameSite=None cookies

supportedFeatures.description: If enabled, cookies without SameSite restrictions must also be Secure. If a cookie without SameSite restrictions is set without the Secure attribute, it will be rejected. This flag only has an effect if "SameSite by default cookies" is also enabled.
supportedFeatures.name: Cookies without SameSite must be secure

supportedFeatures.description: When the flag is set to enabled, pages are allowed to show popups while they are being unloaded.
supportedFeatures.name: Allows a page to show popups during its unloading

supportedFeatures.description: Allows synchronous XHR requests during page dismissal when the page is being navigated away or closed by the user.
supportedFeatures.name: Allows synchronous XHR requests in page dismissal

supportedFeatures.description: If enabled, HTML forms elements will be rendered using an updated style.
supportedFeatures.name: Web Platform Controls updated UI

supportedFeatures.description: Run Audio Worklet operation on a realtime priority thread for better audio stream stability.
supportedFeatures.name: Use realtime priority thread for Audio Worklet

supportedFeatures.description: Redesign of the privacy settings card to make it more prominent and and easier to use.
supportedFeatures.name: Privacy Settings Redesign

supportedFeatures.description: Show messages in DevTools about upcoming deprecations that would affect sent/received cookies.
supportedFeatures.name: Cookie deprecation messages

supportedFeatures.description: When enabled, if credit card upload succeeds, the avatar button will show a highlight, otherwise the icon will be updated and if it is clicked, the save card failure bubble will be shown.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable feedback for credit card upload flow

supportedFeatures.description: Enables the experimental Font Access APIs, giving websites access to enumerate local fonts and access their table data.
supportedFeatures.name: Font Access APIs

supportedFeatures.description: When enable, mouse down does not implicit capture for iframe.
supportedFeatures.name: Disable mouse implicit capture for iframe

supportedFeatures.description: Enables the new, experimental passphrase type for sync data
supportedFeatures.name: Enable trusted vault sync passphrase type

supportedFeatures.description: Enables the Global Media Controls UI in the toolbar.
supportedFeatures.name: Global Media Controls

supportedFeatures.description: Shows Cast sessions in the Global Media Controls UI. Requires #global-media-controls and #cast-media-route-provider to also be enabled.
supportedFeatures.name: Global Media Controls for Cast

supportedFeatures.description: Enables Picture-in-Picture controls in the Global Media Controls UI. Requires #global-media-controls to also be enabled.
supportedFeatures.name: Global Media Controls Picture-in-Picture

supportedFeatures.description: Use the Windows OS spell checker to find spelling mistakes and provide spelling suggestions instead of using the Hunspell engine.
supportedFeatures.name: Use the Windows OS spell checker

supportedFeatures.description: Use both the Windows OS spell checker and the Hunspell engine to find spelling mistakes and provide spelling suggestions. Use the Windows OS spell checker first, but if a language isn't supported, fall back to the Hunspell engine. The "Use the Windows OS spell checker" feature flag must be enabled, otherwise this will have no effect.
supportedFeatures.name: Use hybrid spell checking on Windows

supportedFeatures.description: If enabled, a Safety Tip UI may be displayed when visiting or interacting with a site Chrome believes may be suspicious.
supportedFeatures.name: Show Safety Tip UI when visiting low-reputation websites

supportedFeatures.description: Reduces disk activity during media playback, which can result in power savings.
supportedFeatures.name: Turn off caching of streaming media to disk.

supportedFeatures.description: Enables cooperative scheduling in Blink.
supportedFeatures.name: Cooperative Scheduling

supportedFeatures.description: Enable deferring synchronous script on slow pages.
supportedFeatures.name: DeferAllScript previews

supportedFeatures.description: Skips checking optimization hints for Defer Script previews and assumes that the ECT trigger threshold is set to 4G (which is otherwise provided by the optimization hints). Rest of the checks are still executed.
supportedFeatures.name: Skip checking optimization hints for Defer Script previews

supportedFeatures.description: Decode and render 4:2:0 formatted jpeg images from YUV instead of RGB.This feature requires GPU or OOP rasterization to also be enabled.
supportedFeatures.name: YUV decoding for JPEG

supportedFeatures.description: Decode and render lossy WebP images from YUV instead of RGB. You must also have GPU rasterization or OOP rasterization.
supportedFeatures.name: YUV Decoding for WebP

supportedFeatures.description: When enabled, Chrome may query a configured DoH server for HTTPSSVC records. If any HTTPSSVC records are returned, Chrome may upgrade the URL to HTTPS. If the records indicate support for QUIC, Chrome may attempt QUIC on the first connection.
supportedFeatures.name: Support for HTTPSSVC records in DNS.

supportedFeatures.description: Enables DNS over HTTPS. When this feature is enabled, your browser may try to use a secure HTTPS connection to look up the addresses of websites and other web resources.
supportedFeatures.name: Secure DNS lookups

supportedFeatures.description: Enables experimental supports for Web Bundles (Bundled HTTP Exchanges) navigation.
supportedFeatures.name: Web Bundles

supportedFeatures.description: If enabled, when autofill recognizes a UPI/VPA value in a payment form, it will offer to save it. If saved, it will be offered for filling in fields which expect a VPA.
supportedFeatures.name: Offer save and autofill of UPI/VPA values

supportedFeatures.description: Enables quieter permission prompts for notification permission requests. When a site wishes to show notifications, the usual modal dialog is replaced with a quieter version.
supportedFeatures.name: Quieter notification permission prompts

supportedFeatures.description: Enables storing passwords in a second, Gaia-account-scoped storage for signed-in but not syncing users
supportedFeatures.name: Enable the account data storage for passwords

supportedFeatures.description: Improved UI in Incognito mode for third-party cookie blocking.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable improved cookie controls UI in incognito mode

supportedFeatures.description: Enables an improved UI for existing third-party cookie blocking users.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable improved UI for third-party cookie blocking

supportedFeatures.description: When enabled and where available, forms filled using Google Payments server cards are populated with cloud token details, including CPAN (cloud tokenized version of the Primary Account Number) and dCVV (dynamic CVV).
supportedFeatures.name: Return cloud token details for server credit cards when possible

supportedFeatures.description: Enables back-forward cache. NOTE: this feature is highly experimental and will lead to various breakages, up to and including user data loss. Do not enable unless you work on this feature
supportedFeatures.name: Back-forward cache

supportedFeatures.description: Replaces the default scroll animation with Impulse-style scroll animations.
supportedFeatures.name: Impulse-style scroll animations

supportedFeatures.description: Don't wait for layer activation before beginning new frame.
supportedFeatures.name: Parallelize layers

supportedFeatures.description: If enabled, mousewheel and keyboard scrolls will scroll by a percentage of the scroller size.
supportedFeatures.name: Percent-based Scrolling

supportedFeatures.description: Refactoring project that eliminates scroll handling code from Blink. Does not affect behavior or performance.
supportedFeatures.name: Scroll Unification

supportedFeatures.description: Enables Elastic Overscrolling for Windows on touchscreens and precision touchpads.
supportedFeatures.name: Elastic Overscroll for Windows

supportedFeatures.description: Show security warnings for sites that use legacy TLS versions (TLS 1.0 and TLS 1.1), which are deprecated and will be removed in the future.
supportedFeatures.name: Show security warnings for sites using legacy TLS versions

supportedFeatures.description: Enables usage of the Windows.Devices.Geolocation WinRT APIs on Windows for geolocation
supportedFeatures.name: WinRT Geolocation Implementation

supportedFeatures.description: Enables an experimental effect which attempts to mitigate "jelly-scrolling". This is an experimental implementation with known bugs, visual artifacts, and performance cost. This implementation may be removed at any time.
supportedFeatures.name: Experimental de-jelly effect

supportedFeatures.description: Allows tabs to be dragged between any browsers that support tabs, including apps
supportedFeatures.name: Mix browser type tabs

supportedFeatures.description: Unloads ads that use too many device resources.
supportedFeatures.name: Heavy Ad Intervention

supportedFeatures.description: Enables privacy mitigations for the heavy ad intervention. Disabling this makes the intervention deterministic. Defaults to enabled.
supportedFeatures.name: Heavy ad privacy mitigations

supportedFeatures.description: When enabled, the browser will handle navigations to ftp:// URLs by either showing a directory listing or downloading the resource over FTP. When disabled, the browser has no special handling for ftp:// URLs and by default defer handling of the URL to the underlying platform.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable support for FTP URLs

supportedFeatures.description: When enabled, if all requirements are met, Autofill will offer to use virtual credit cards in form filling.
supportedFeatures.name: Offer to use cloud token virtual card in Autofill

supportedFeatures.description: Allows raw / unsanitized clipboard content to be read and written. See https://github.com/WICG/raw-clipboard-access.
supportedFeatures.name: Raw Clipboard

supportedFeatures.description: Slow the maximum interrupt timer on battery power to 8 ms, instead of the default 4 ms.
supportedFeatures.name: Slow maximum DC interrupt timer

supportedFeatures.description: Enable the new sync setup friendly settings
supportedFeatures.name: Sync setup friendly settings

supportedFeatures.description: Set the User-Agent request header to a static string that conforms to the current User-Agent string format but only reveals desktop vs Android and if the 'mobile' flag is set
supportedFeatures.name: Freeze User-Agent request header

supportedFeatures.description: Enables taking snapshots of the user data directory after a Chrome update and restoring them after a version rollback.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable user data snapshots

supportedFeatures.description: Run the video capture service in the browser process.
supportedFeatures.name: Run video capture service in browser

supportedFeatures.description: Enable connection errors and interstitials for sites that use legacy TLS versions (TLS 1.0 and TLS 1.1), which are deprecated and will be removed  in the future.
supportedFeatures.name: Enforce deprecation of legacy TLS versions

supportedFeatures.description: Enables the Bulk Password Check feature for signed-in users.
supportedFeatures.name: Bulk Password Check

supportedFeatures.description: When printing to a PDF file, generated a tagged (accessible) PDF.
supportedFeatures.name: Export Tagged PDF

supportedFeatures.description: Change password when password leak is detected.
supportedFeatures.name: Rework password change flow

supportedFeatures.description: Enable/Disable the usage of MediaFoundation for video capture. Fall back to DirectShow if disabled.
supportedFeatures.name: MediaFoundation Video Capture

supportedFeatures.description: Provides an omnibox context menu option that prevents URL elisions.
supportedFeatures.name: Context menu show full URLs

supportedFeatures.description: Redirects color requests to the color provider where possible.
supportedFeatures.name: Color Provider Redirection

supportedFeatures.description: Enables the prototype Trust Token API (https://github.com/wicg/trust-token-api).
supportedFeatures.name: Enable Trust Tokens

supportedFeatures.description: Enables Media History which records data around media playbacks on websites.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable Media History

supportedFeatures.description: Enables Nearby Sharing for sharing content between devices.
supportedFeatures.name: Nearby Sharing

supportedFeatures.description: When enabled, if Google Payments cards were given nicknames in a Google Pay app, Autofill will surface these nicknames in suggestions.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable surfacing masked server card nicknames

supportedFeatures.description: When disabled, turns off all AppCache code so that developers can test that their code works properly in the future when AppCache has been removed.
supportedFeatures.name: AppCache web API and browser backend

supportedFeatures.description: If enabled, when a server card is unmasked, its info will be cached until page navigation to simplify consecutive fills on the same page.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable Autofill to cache unmasked server card info

supportedFeatures.description: When enabled, all Autofill payments bubbles will not be dismissed upon navigation.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable Autofill payments sticky bubbles

supportedFeatures.description: Make pending 'display: auto' web fonts enter the swap or failure period immediately before reaching the LCP time limit (~2500ms), so that web fonts do not become a source of bad LCP (Largest Contentful Paint).
supportedFeatures.name: Align 'font-display: auto' timeout with LCP goal

options.description: Enabled switch to failure after 2250ms since navigation
Enabled switch to failure after 2000ms since navigation
Enabled switch to failure after 1750ms since navigation
Enabled switch to failure after 1500ms since navigation
Enabled switch to failure after 1250ms since navigation
Enabled switch to failure after 1000ms since navigation
Enabled switch to swap after 2250ms since navigation
Enabled switch to swap after 2000ms since navigation
Enabled switch to swap after 1750ms since navigation
Enabled switch to swap after 1500ms since navigation
Enabled switch to swap after 1250ms since navigation
Enabled switch to swap after 1000ms since navigation

supportedFeatures.description: Enable new features that affect setting, sending, and managing cookies. The enabled features are subject to change at any time.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable experimental cookie features

supportedFeatures.description: When enabled, Google-issued cards will be available in the autofill suggestions.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable Autofill Google-issued card

supportedFeatures.description: When enabled, Views-based text fields take focus on touch-up instead of touch-down. This includes the Omnibox.
supportedFeatures.name: Focus UI text fields on touch-up

supportedFeatures.description: Enables an experimental permission prompt that uses a chip in the location bar.
supportedFeatures.name: Permissions Chip Experiment

supportedFeatures.description: If enabled, Chrome may promote profile creation after signin on the web.
supportedFeatures.name: Dice Web-Signin Interception

supportedFeatures.description: Enables in-progress features for the canvas 2D API. See https://github.com/fserb/canvas2d.
supportedFeatures.name: Experimental canvas 2D API features

supportedFeatures.description: Enable the translation of sub frames (as well as the main frame)
supportedFeatures.name: Translate sub frames

supportedFeatures.description: Enables the Media Feeds feature which allows us to fetch feeds of media items from websites that support the feature.
supportedFeatures.name: Enables Media Feeds

supportedFeatures.description: When enabled, nicknames for credit cards will be able to be uploaded to Payments or modified locally.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable Autofill card nickname management

supportedFeatures.description: Enables usage of the Conversion Measurement API.
supportedFeatures.name: Conversion Measurement API

supportedFeatures.description: Enables debug mode for the Conversion Measurement API. This removes all reporting delays and noise. Only works if the Conversion Measurement API is already enabled.
supportedFeatures.name: Conversion Measurement Debug Mode

supportedFeatures.description: Use the dev url for the component updater. This is for internal testing only.
supportedFeatures.name: Use dev updater url

supportedFeatures.description: Allow New Tab Page Branded Wallpapers and user preference.
supportedFeatures.name: New Tab Page Branded Wallpapers

supportedFeatures.description: Force dummy data for the Branded Wallpaper New Tab Page Experience. View rate and user opt-in conditionals will still be followed to decide when to display the Branded Wallpaper.
supportedFeatures.name: New Tab Page Demo Branded Wallpaper

supportedFeatures.description: Enable support for cosmetic filtering
supportedFeatures.name: Enable cosmetic filtering

supportedFeatures.description: Enables faster loading of simplified article-style web pages.
supportedFeatures.name: Enable SpeedReader

supportedFeatures.description: Brave Sync is disabled by default
supportedFeatures.name: Enable Brave Sync

supportedFeatures.description: Use custom theme for Brave Super Referral
supportedFeatures.name: Enable Brave Super Referral

unsupportedFeatures.description: Support in WebRTC for decoding video streams using platform hardware.
unsupportedFeatures.name: WebRTC hardware video decoding

unsupportedFeatures.description: Support in WebRTC for encoding video streams using platform hardware.
unsupportedFeatures.name: WebRTC hardware video encoding

unsupportedFeatures.description: Enable debugging mode to override certain behavior of notification scheduler system for easier manual testing.
unsupportedFeatures.name: Notification scheduler debug options

unsupportedFeatures.description: Use double buffer for compositing (instead of triple-buffering). Latency should be reduced in some cases. On the other hand, more skipped frames are expected.
unsupportedFeatures.name: Double buffered compositing
